Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2011 11:06PM kriskat wrote: Racy- I am looking into extensions. I used the cold caps and kept most hair but the hair I did lose makes it difficult to style. My stylist says we can donor but I am worried.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 10, 2012 11:20AM kriskat wrote: Megs. I have done great lengths hair extensions and I love them!!!! I have had them in for about 2 months. I didn't lose all of my hair because I also used cold caps- yes, I am very vain:). So I went straight from my wig ( which was almost spot on to my real hair) to extensions. Most people didn't know about my cancer and I preferred it that way. I think the extensions gave me back me.
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2011 09:44AM kriskat wrote: Missy111-My hair situation is a little different. I used cold caps and kept most of my hair but it thinned in several spots and I wanted to get extensions to fill in so I went for consult . The guy is afraid if we put them in too early-I am 3 months PFC- that I may suffer from tension alopecia. So I am waiting til after the first of the year. But he did tell me that ha has placed extensions in hair as short as 3 inches
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: May 12, 2012 09:33PM kriskat wrote: My situation is different in that I had hair all different lengths. I lost alot of hair around the crown so I literally had all lengths. The shortest was probably 2 inches and the rest longer ( I looked like a bird with a mullet). We put 12 inch ext in all throughout my hair. I did alot if research to see what would be easiest on my fragile hair. The great length ext are expensive but they typically last around 9 months if taken care of properly. U need to someone who has alot of experience. I go in about every 4 weeks for color at the roots( my hair grows fast). It was the single best thing I could've done for my self esteem. My husband couldn't believe how it transformed me mentally back to my old self !! If someone would like to see pics please pm me and I would be happy to send u a couple!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Feb 10, 2011 08:45PM kriskat wrote: Hi all!  Hope it's ok for me to stop in.  I recently received path report from my lump.  My mass was right @ 2cm and I had 1/11 nodes involved.  I think that puts me at a IIb or at least I hope it does.  I am also er/pr/her postive.  See my onc on 2/21, jus ready to get this process going! Anyway, it's nice to have a place for those of us with node involvement can go.  Here's a question for you ladies that I am struggling with.  My family and I have a yearly trip coming up 3/10-13.  We've taken this trip with our daughter for the last 15 years.  I am thinking about not starting chemo until we get back.  Should I even be considering this??? Thoughts???
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2011 03:01PM kriskat wrote: Thanks guys for all the encouraging words about travelling before starting treatment.  I look at it as one of the constants in my life for 15 years and if I didn't go, it would seem like I am letting the cancer win.  My sister, who is a nurse, is strongly discouraging me from taking the trip.  She thinks I need to build up my immunity-even though I am healthy as a horse other than bc......
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Feb 21, 2011 06:26PM kriskat wrote: Had my trip to the onc today.  It went really well-loved her.  Her response about the node involvement was that it did it's job.  She has agreed to let me start TCH on March 14 so I can still take our trip.  She believes in living your life while going thru this-work, vacations etc.  I have really good veins so we are going to wait and see after first visit how it goes and then decide on whether or not to get a port.  She was just so confident I could get thru this and so confident that the drugs for my triple positive status (and the new ones coming own the pipeline) would have such an impact on my treatment.  Now I wish I hadn't stayed up all night worrying.  Finally, I think i mentioned how terrified I am of the scans....she will not order pet (too many false positives) but does want to do a ct of abd/chest.  However, it is up to me  and I'm still on the fence.  I told her I am so scared of the outcome that I just don't know if I can do it.  Thoughts???
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2011 10:28AM kriskat wrote: Pej My onc prefers to start with peripheral iv and place port if that doesn't work. I'm ok with that right now but if we have issues she'll order port

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2011 05:56PM kriskat wrote: OK-all you ladies who have went thru this before me-talk me off the ledge.  I see my onc for the first time on Mons 2/21.  I am soooo nervous about the scans that she will order.  I am so paranoid that because of my 1 node being involved that I have mets everywhere.  I am actually more anxious about this than the actual chemo!!!  It just seems like my luck is already so awful-dx at 36 and then a triple positive-that this is my destiny.  Please share some advice here.  and thanks again for all the wonderful support regarding my trip before starting chemo-as long as the onc oks it, we are going:}
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2011 10:15PM kriskat wrote: Thanks everyone for the words of encouragement!  I feel like this is such as bad dream-so days are so much better than others!!! Bdavis-so glad to her that chemo isn't too bad for you ; Lady in Bama:  Read that and thought about it as I was rolled ino surgery.  You know, I thought I had done all the right things, sbe every 4 to 6 weeks, found lump, went to doc next day and biopsy 2 days later, etc.  I was so hoping that I had caught it in time before it got to nodes; although position of mass at 3 o'clock l breast-probably didn't help. Anyway, was pretty disappointed that it made it to sn.  lee-I hope things go well tomorrow-will be thinking about you! librarylil-so interesting how things are done diff; you had chemo first, then surgery In two places- i think that is what worries me most, just the thought of the worry that comes with every cough, ache and pain
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2011 11:38PM kriskat wrote: bdavis: How is chemo going for you?  Hopefully not too many side effects!  Btw, I had a lady on the cold caps page email me a couple of things and one was a list of potential chemo side effects and how to treat.  PM with your email if interested.  I sent it to a friend who went thru this and she just wished she would have had a guide like that when she was dx.  Lots of great info from gals who have been thru it!

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2011 08:21AM kriskat wrote: I chose to only tell anfewnreally close people- my brother was getting ready to deploy for 9 months so I chose not to add to his stress and if my dad knew then my while community would know. I am in the later part of treatment now(rads and herceptin) and they still don't know. I too am a very private person and feel that I should have the power of who to tell and not to tell.
